Development¶

Tip

The AAAAAA README, at the bottom of the AAAAAA GitHub repository, contains some additional links that are commonly referenced during development as well as some philosophies and directory structure notes

Tools¶

All the software tools used to create the AAAAAA are open source:

  • The Anaconda Distribution is used to manage all of the Python packages in the AAAAAA

  • pytest is used to create tests for the AAAAAA source code

  • Jupyter Notebooks are used for interactive development documentation

  • Read the Dox with Sphinx is used to document code via reStructuredText (reST)

    • This documentation is built using the Read the Docs Sphinx Theme

  • VS Code is the preferred integrated development environment used to edit code and documentation. Extensions used:

    • Python
    • RST preview for editing reST
    • Test Explorer UI for visualising pytest tests during development

Code¶

Style¶

  • PEP8 for Python code
  • Python Developer’s Guide for reST

Access¶

Source code for the AAAAAA is available on Github, and alnoki’s Github profile contains assorted repositories with extra tutorial code on associated topics

Documentation¶

Documentation is written according to a Style guide for Sphinx-based documentations

Jupyter Notebooks¶

Jupyter Notebooks are used for some analyses, and alnoki’s notebooks for the AAAAAA can be accessed here. References to specific notebooks should be found throughout the AAAAAA documentation, but the above link is for the highest-level notebook directory
